resources:
GroupNumber8_DecisionBasedGame something START Choice 1 Choice 2 Choice 3 Choice 4 >Continue Name She looks up at you curiously and pauses. She\'s not sure if she should tell; she\'s much more worried about you snitching on her to her mother. You know she reads late into the night. At home you can see the lights from the houses. Her room is lit dimly with a candle that flickers from the cold wind. //Scenario Prompt Scenario //Choices Choice 1 Choice 2 Choice 3 Choice 4 //Extra >Continue //character name Name //character image character_img //background image background_img //Extra scenario Scenario //Choice 4 scenario Scenario //Choice 3 scenario Scenario //Choice 2 scenario Scenario //Choice 1 scenario Scenario //start from here

 

The dark sky looms far above, framed by tall red sentinels swathed in layers of rust. 

 

Rain patters against your cheeks.

 

>Continue bg_start Scenario_0_0_1

 

You are alone.

[Are you alive?] [Touch your neck] [Move your hand] [Stand up] [Return] bg_start Scenario_0 Scenario_0_0_1_4 Scenario_0_0_1_3 Scenario_0_0_1_2 Scenario_0_0_1_1

 

You lay on the ground, body swimming in liquids that smell of booze and canal water. It fills your nostrils with a disgusting sense of dread and familiarity. The odor makes you cringe.

 

You are alive.

 

[Return] bg_start Scenario_0_0_1

 

Your fingers flutter against your pulse. It is empty, the familiar weight a phantom against your skin.

 

Your ring is gone.

 

[Return] bg_start Scenario_0_0_1

 

You try to move your hand. Pain shoots up your arm and you grit your teeth. After a moment, you continue. You raise your hand to your face and it comes back clear.

 

No blood.

 

[Return] bg_start Scenario_0_0_1

 

You lift yourself up from the ground, elbows propping up against the cold wet floor. Your legs are unsteady as you rise to your feet. A pool of water mirrors your reflection.

 

You look pathetic.

 

>Continue bg_start Scenario_0_1

 

The wind whips against your face. 

>Continue mc bg_start Scenario_0_1_1

 

Your ring is gone.

 

Look for it.

 

[Search the pier] [Search the harbor] [Search the houses] [Search the coast] "" bg_start Scenario_0_1_1 Scenario_4 Scenario_3 Scenario_2 Scenario_1 ""

 

You walk to the pier, concrete pavement making way to brittle wood. Before you, a man stands in his toll booth, gloved hands busy with counting the meager coins scattered across the counter. Business is slow.

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_0_1

 

Birds fly overhead.

 

The island in the distance feels so far away.

[Look at the sky] [Search the bench] [Search the floor] [Approach the toll booth] [Return] pier Scenario_0_1_1 Scenario_1_4 Scenario_1_3 Scenario_1_2 Scenario_1_1

 

\"It\'s raining. Why are you looking at the sky?\"

\"Do you think a bird swallowed your ring? Idiot.\"

[Return] mc pier Scenario_1_0_1

 

You turn your gaze to the bench settled beside the pier\'s railings. To its left is a trash can tucked into the corner. You approach it cautiously, memories of last night churning within your mind.

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_2_0_1

 

Still, you do not remember.

 

It smells of booze.

[Ignore it] [Take a closer look] [Return] pier Scenario_1_0_1 Scenario_1_2_2 Scenario_1_2_1

 

The bench calls to you, begging you to sit on it. You tear your eyes away and ignore it. There is still work to be done.

 

You cannot rest.

[Return] mc pier Scenario_1_2_0_1

 

You take a closer look at the bench. It is old and worn. Rust eats away at the metal, and graffiti settles between the grain. You can make out a few words carved into the surface.

 

\"Wala na tay kinaugmaon.\"

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_2_2_0_1

 

You look at the desolation around you.

[Agree] [Disagree] "" pier Scenario_1_2_2_2 Scenario_1_2_2_1

 

\"They\'re right. The world has left you for dead.\"

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_2_2_0

 

Even at the end of the world, there is still hope. She has not given up on you yet.

 

You are still alive.

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_2_2_0

 

The trashcan is filled with bottles and discarded cigarettes. The air smells of mint and smoke.

 

Your ring is not here.

[Return] mc pier Scenario_1_2_0_1

 

You search the floor. The wood is wet and creaks underneath your muddy boots. Between the cracks you see waves crash against the rocks beneath. Falling here would surely result in death.

 

You shiver.

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_3_0_1

 

Your ring is not here; and even if it was, it would\'ve long been taken by the waves.

 

You can not give up so soon.

[Return] mc pier Scenario_1_0_1

 

Before you even open your mouth, the man raises his head. He does not speak, merely nods in greeting. His beard is white with age, and his skin has seen better days.

>Continue \????? jonah pier Scenario_1_4_0_1

 

Jonah. His name is Jonah.

[\"Good morning Jonah.\"] [\"Did you see me last night?\"] [\"Have you seen my ring?\"] [Return] pier Scenario_1_0_1 Scenario_1_4_3 Scenario_1_4_2 Scenario_1_4_1

 

\"Good morning.\" he replies, voice like gravel. He tries to smile but fails. 

[\"Slow day?\"] Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_1_0_1

 

He sighs and nods his head, momentarily abandoning the coins on the counter. His eyes drift from you to the island far from shore.

>Continue Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_1_0_1_1

 

\"Tag-ulan is starting.\" Jonah shrugs. \"You know how it is. Tourists don\'t like the rain.\"

>Continue Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_1_0_1_1_1

 

He goes back to counting.

[Return] Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_0_1

 

He scratches his beard, gazes far off. His memory has weakened with age; often, they are swallowed by the haze. He hums as the image returns to him.

 

A small victory in the face of death.

>Continue Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_2_0_1

 

\"Yes.\" he answers, a small smile stretching at the corners of his mouth.

 

\"You were here last night with that friend of yours. Drinking.\"

[Motion your neck] Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_2_0_1_1

 

His brows draw together, confused. Of course, he doesn\'t understand. Idiot. You should\'ve explained better.

>Continue Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_2_0_1_1_1

 

\"Was I wearing…\" you mutter, motioning to your neck again.

 

He is still confused.

[Return] mc pier Scenario_1_4_0_1

 

He quirks a brow and looks at the empty hollow of your neck. A look of recognition passes his face.

 

\"You mean your necklace?\"

[\"Yeah. My ring was on it.\"] Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_3_0_1

 

\"No, sorry.\" he sounds genuinely apologetic.

 

\"I\'ll tell you if I\'ve seen it.\"

 

>Continue Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_3_0_1_1

 

\"Thank you.\"

>Continue mc pier Scenario_1_4_3_0_1_1_1

 

\"Does Maria know?\"

[You cringe] Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_3_0_1_1_1_1

 

Before you can stop it, your eye twitches. You refrain from doing any other unsavory expressions. Jonah is old, his memory fails him.

 

Soon, time will eat at you as well.

[\"She\'s doing well.\"] mc pier Scenario_1_4_3_0_1_1_1_1_1

 

Jonah smiles.

 

\"That\'s great. I\'ve always been rather fond of that girl. Tell her I said hi.\"

[You cringe] Jonah jonah pier Scenario_1_4_3_0_1_1_1_1_1_1

 

You nod, smiling at him in return.

 

The phantom weight hangs heavy on your neck. The noose around it tightens just a bit more.

[Return] mc pier Scenario_1_4_0_1

 

Surely your ring is somewhere around here; after all, this is where you\'d woken up moments prior. Trucks are stationed to the side, drivers sitting underneath the roof for shelter. Containers surround you in a maze of dull colors. Most of them are locked.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_0_1

 

You hear the wind as it slips through the cracks. Hollow.

 

Some of them are open.

[Ask the drivers] [Search the trucks] [Search the containers] [Search your home] [Return] harbor Scenario_0_1_1 Scenario_2_4 Scenario_2_3 Scenario_2_2 Scenario_2_1

 

You approach the drivers. They are all engrossed in a conversation about fish sale prices. Some are asleep.

 

When you arrive they all greet you before returning to their previous topic.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_1_0_1

 

One of them stands to meet you. He is tall, muscular, and stocky. His gaze is kind as he gives you a hug in greeting.

>Continue \????? seth harbor Scenario_2_1_0_1_1

 

"Brad." he starts "Are you okay? Ni hawa lagi kag pina-live?"

 

He\'s so muscular you briefly forget his name. You know it, however.

 

Seth.

>Continue Muscular man seth harbor Scenario_2_1_0_1_1_1

 

You pat his back emphatically.

[\"Good morning.\"] [\"I left?\"] [Return] harbor Scenario_2_0_1 Scenario_2_1_2 Scenario_2_1_1

 

The man smiles. \"Good morning sad.\"

[Return] Seth seth harbor Scenario_2_1_0_1_1_1 
 

He nods, his arm now moving to lay comfortably on top of your shoulders.

\"We drank last night, remember? Until you and Junjun started fighting again and left. Okay ra mo?\"

[\"Okay ra mi.\"] Seth seth harbor Scenario_2_1_2_0_1

 

You try your best not to cringe and instead nod at him awkwardly from your position tucked underneath his shoulder.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_1_2_0_1_1

 

The look he sends you is unsure, but thankfully he doesn\'t press further.

[\"Have you seen my ring?\"] Seth seth harbor Scenario_2_1_2_0_1_1_1 
 

A look of understanding passes his face.

Empathy. He shakes his head at you and shrugs.

>Continue Seth seth harbor Scenario_2_1_2_0_1_1_1_1 
 

\"Wala. I\'m sorry to say this but you should probably ask Junjun. He was the last one with you yesterday.\"

[\"Thank you.\"] Seth seth harbor Scenario_2_1_2_0_1_1_1_1_1 
 

He smiles heartily and gives your shoulders a little shake before letting go.

 

\"Hey, chin up. Makita ra nimo na puhon.\"

>Continue Seth seth harbor Scenario_2_1_2_0_1_1_1_1_1_1 
 

You muster a smile at him. It looks pathetic.

 

\"Puhon.\"

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_1_0_1_1_1 
 

\"What are you thinking? Of course, you can\'t do that. It\'s private property, and you\'re not part of the police. If the drivers found your ring they\'d return it to you. They know you.\"

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_2_0_1

 

\"Still, you spend some time checking the ground around the trucks and come back empty.\"

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_0_1

 

You comb through the steel sentinels. Some are new, their company logos emblazoned on the sides. Most are old, the salty air chipping at the paint and bathing them in rust.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

Take your pick.

[Red Container] [Blue Container] [Yellow container] [Return] harbor Scenario_2_0_1 Scenario_2_3_3 Scenario_2_3_2 Scenario_2_3_1

 

A red container stands before you. It is dark on the inside, but the doors are wide open.

[Look inside] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_1_0_1

 

There is nothing within it.

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

You approach the blue container. It\'s one of the more pristine ones, too young for the sea to have taken it as its own. It is located beside a wall, far enough from the others to be undisturbed but not far enough to be suspicious.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_2_0_1

 

You would have passed it by had it not been for the soft snores emanating from within

 

Maybe you should open it.

[No.] [Open] [Return] harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1 Scenario_2_3_2_2 Scenario_2_3_2_1

 

If someone is sleeping inside, it is none of your business.

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

The snores, you find, really did come from within.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_0_1 A young man, barely 20, sleeps on the floor. Underneath him is an aged patchwork of a bed that looks more like a rug than it does a mattress. Based on the amount of furniture and trinkets around him, it seems that he lives here on a permanent or semi-permanent basis. >Continue \????? young_man harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_0_1_1

 

You could wake him up

[No.] [Yes.] [Return] harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1 Scenario_2_3_2_2_2 Scenario_2_3_2_2_1

 

This young man has clearly been through some things, and the last thing he needs is for some weird drunk to disturb his sleep. Leave him alone.

>Continue young_man harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_1_0_1

 

You close the door and leave.

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

A young man shouldn\'t be sleeping here in the cold like this. Besides, containers are basically saunas in the heat. He\'d cook himself alive when the sun comes out.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_2_0_1

 

You approach his sleeping form, the cold metal creaking underneath your feet. It reverberates through the room. Even the person\'s snoring is not enough to drown out the noise.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_2_0_1_1

 

Still, he does not wake.

>Continue young_man harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_2_0_1_1_1

 

You poke him to wake him up, gently increasing the pressure. He continues to snore, not knowing any better. There is nothing for you to do here anymore.

>Continue young_man harbor Scenario_2_3_2_2_2_0_1_1_1_1

 

You search the inside of your pockets for a snack and come out with a chocolate Venus bar. You leave it out on the blessedly dry table.

 

You leave.

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

You approach the yellow container. At least, you think it\'s yellow. Age has not been kind to it. It is more rust than it is metal.

 

You look inside. It is filled with discarded items.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_0_1

 

Something glints in your peripheral.
[Furniture] [Clothes] [Toys] [Return] harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1 Scenario_2_3_3_3 Scenario_2_3_3_2 Scenario_2_3_3_1

 

There are sofas and tables pushed up against the container\'s walls. Above, the broken roof drips rainwater onto the sodden floor. If the sun were out, they would shine through the holes.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_1_0_1

 

You have a feeling that the furniture is the only thing keeping this place upright. It\'s best not to touch them for now.

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

Articles of clothing are strewn about the inside of the container. They are bound in tightly wound cubes covered in plastic… Well, at least they used to be. Most of them have been opened long before you came. 

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_2_0_1

 

The hardened ties that once held them together are broken, showing evidence of knives and determination.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_2_0_1_1

 

Air blows in from the open doors. The ties move and creak happily, waving at you in a strange sort of dance.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_2_0_1_1_1

 

The beast has left its horde, and the people rejoice. They take what little treasures they can for their own. They needed it more, anyway. With them, it is in much better hands

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1

 

An assortment of toys is laid out before you. They are either torn, muddy, or caked in a layer of dust. Some are broken beyond repair. One toy stands out to you from the wreckage. It is a model of the rocket used in the Artemis missions.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_3_0_1

 

You wanted to be one of them, once. A man, an Indio man, flying past the skies to the world beyond. It was a stupid dream, but it kept you off the streets, kept you studying at home. Maybe that\'s why your mother let you think you could be one.

>Continue mc harbor Scenario_2_3_3_3_0_1_1

 

What were you thinking? You\'d never be able to afford it. And even if you did, they\'d never let your kind onto their porcelain towers.

 

Best not to think about it.

[Return] mc harbor Scenario_2_3_0_1 You turn to the small building situated past the harbor. It rises above the water on stone legs, waiting. In the first revolution, it served as a loyalist watch house that monitored the bay for deserters and refugees. There used to be a tower beside it, but it has since been torn down. >Continue mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1

 

The rubble can still be found scattered around it from the fall.

[It\'s old.] mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1

 

It is. The city has already built a new tower further into the gulf. At night, you can see its light, spinning for eternity.

 

Like the world\'s most messed up disco ball.

[Then why is it still here?] mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1_1

 

It was too expensive to tear down. Besides, you live there now. The war has long since passed. Mostly you just make sure people don\'t throw themselves into the sea.

 

What are you waiting for?

[Go home] mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1_1_1

 

You enter the small building. It is concrete, from when concrete was still a new innovation. Now, it just looks old… and cheap. There is no paint on the walls, just cracks from past earthquakes and water stains. The floor is blessedly dry.

>Continue mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1_1_1_1

 

Around you, there are signs of life.

 

Rain drips from the roof into a halfway full bucket

[Check the kitchen] [Check the bed] [Check the dresser] [Return] house Scenario_2_0_1 Scenario_2_4_3 Scenario_2_4_2 Scenario_2_4_1

 

The kitchen, which barely counts as one, is clean. All of the utensils are in order… save for two mugs. One is filled with water, the other half-drunk coffee.

 

You check the sink for your ring before pouring them both in. You\'ll clean them later.

[Return] mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1_1_1_1

 

The bed is messy, but the sheets are brand new. When you climb it to look for your ring, it creaks underneath you.

>Continue mc house Scenario_2_4_2_0_1

 

The pillows smell of beer, sweat, and smoke. Underneath, there is an undercurrent of something lighter…

 

Mint.

>Continue mc house Scenario_2_4_2_0_1_1

 

The scent whispers something into your ear.

 

You will not find it here.

[Return] mc house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1_1_1_1 Your dresser has seen better days. The original wood is a beautiful deep brown, salvaged from the maws of the beast. When you took it home, it looked worse for wear. Still, you\'d patched it up with what you could find and set it up beside your bed. It\'s one of your older pieces of furniture. You love it dearly. >Continue mc house Scenario_2_4_3_0_1

 

You check the inside of the dresser and come back empty. The items laid on top of it are sparse.

 

Take a look

[Check the ashtray] [Check the picture frame] [Return] house Scenario_2_4_0_1_1_1_1_1 Scenario_2_4_3_2 Scenario_2_4_3_1

 

You check the tray; it is half-full with ash and cigarette stubs. The brand is a familiar one, but you do not smoke…

 

You take the tray and dump its contents somewhere safe.

[Return] mc house Scenario_2_4_3_0_1

 

There is only one picture framed on top of your dresser. It is of a woman in her thirties with light skin and auburn hair. She has her arms wrapped around your shoulders, a cigarette alight on her lips. Behind her, an expanse of sea.

>Continue mc house Scenario_2_4_3_2_0_1

 

You were both younger then. Tears form at the corners of your eyes.

[You miss her] mc house Scenario_2_4_3_2_0_1_1

 

You choke back a sob and look away. As you do so, your eyes catch on to a slip of paper tucked underneath the frame. You take it in your hands. \"Take care, langga.\" is scrawled onto it in neat handwriting.

 

You smile.

[Return] mc house Scenario_2_4_3_0_1 You head towards the sound of distant laughter. In front of you is a neighborhood, one part on land the other suspended precariously above water on thin wooden stilts. As you enter, children run past you in a flurry of energy. One of them knocks into you but apologizes before rejoining the others. >Continue mc town Scenario_3_0_1

 

You nod at them and then turn to look at what\'s in front of you.

 

Rain patters against the darkened streets and drains out into the sea. It should be cold—-and it is, but somehow you don\'t feel it.

>Continue mc town Scenario_3_0_1_1

 

Most people have run under roofs for shelter except for one girl who stands underneath a drain pipe attached to a rain gutter.

 

The rain has soaked your clothes.

[The tattoo artist] [The child] [The Smoker] [The girl on the balcony] [Return] town Scenario_0_1_1 Scenario_3_4 Scenario_3_3 Scenario_3_2 Scenario_3_1

 

You approach the dark-haired lady who looks at you with barely contained disdain. Her arm is covered in tattoos. You feel as if they run further—-past her sleeves, past her skin, past muscle and bone.

 

Etched into her soul.

>Continue \????? tattoo_lady town Scenario_3_1_0_1

 

In her hand is a lit cigarette.

 

Say something cool.

[\"Hey.\"] [\"You\'re so hot.\"] [\"Can you tattoo me?\"] [Return] town Scenario_3_0_1_1 Scenario_3_1_3 Scenario_3_1_2 Scenario_3_1_1

 

Her brows furrow.

 

She ignores you.

[Return] Hot tattoo lady tattoo_lady town Scenario_3_1_0_1

 

Don\'t say that. You don\'t even know her name.

 

Your mouth flounders for words.

>Continue mc town Scenario_3_1_2_0_1

 

She ignores you.

[Return] Hot tattoo lady tattoo_lady town Scenario_3_1_0_1

 

She ignores you.

[Return] Hot tattoo lady tattoo_lady town Scenario_3_1_0_1

 

Coincidentally, the child is also soaked. She looks up at you from underneath the stream of water, giggling.  She looks like her.

 

You smile.

>Continue \????? ophie town Scenario_3_2_0_1

 

Ophie. Short for Ophelia. \"Hi uncle!\" she greets

 

She\'s her niece. Her blood.

[\"Hi langga.\"] [\"Ophie did you see me last night?\"] [Return] town Scenario_3_0_1_1 Scenario_3_2_2 Scenario_3_2_1

 

She smiles and runs toward you, giving your leg a tight hug before letting go.

 

Ophie cranes her neck to look at your face before taking your hand and pressing it to her forehead. \"Mano po.\"

[Return] Ophie ophie town Scenario_3_2_0_1 She looks up at you curiously and pauses. She\'s not sure if she should tell; she\'s much more worried about you snitching on her to her mother. You know she reads late into the night. At home you can see the lights from the houses. Her room is lit dimly with a candle that flickers from the cold wind. [\"I won\'t tell your mom.\"] Ophie ophie town Scenario_3_2_2_0_1

 

Her eyes light up. She\'s ready to talk now.

>Continue Ophie ophie town Scenario_3_2_2_0_1_1

 

\"I did!\" she nods, flailing her arms around under the stream of water. \"I don\'t know what time it was po but you were at the coast. You were digging the sand po for something, I think.\"

[\"Oh.\"] Ophie ophie town Scenario_3_2_2_0_1_1_1

 

This does not bode well for you.

 

\"Salamat Ophie.\" you smile. You pet her on the head and she swats at you.

>Continue mc town Scenario_3_2_2_0_1_1_1_1

 

The two of you talk about what books she wants to read next. You\'ll buy her another when your sahod comes in.

 

Some time passes.

[Return] mc town Scenario_3_2_0_1 A smoker stands in the dark, a cigarette placed delicately between his lips. He\'s wearing a pressed green shirt tucked into faded jeans and work boots. Your eyes track the elegant cord of muscle up from the base of his neck to his eyes. He is watching you… Like you\'re some sort of animal. >Continue john town Scenario_3_3_0_1

 

He stubs his cigarette in a nearby ashtray and the two of you descend two staircases into the dark.

 

It wouldn\'t do well to have this conversation here.

>Continue john town Scenario_3_3_0_1_1 He sets the flame of his lighter to the butt of a new cigarette. It bathes him in its orange glow. You watch as he leans against one of the stilts. You are now below the village. Barely any light gets through here, but it\'s still enough to see.\n\n Waves crash against your feet and your senses are filled with the scent of sea, smoke, and mint. [\"John."\] John john_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_0_1_1_1

 

You want to breathe it all in.

[\"You left.\"] [\"About last night.\"] [Return] under_the_pier Scenario_3_0_1_1 Scenario_3_3_2 Scenario_3_3_1

 

\"I always leave,\" he replies, voice soft. It\'s almost drowned out by the sound of waves.

 

You cannot let her take him too.

[Beg him to stay] John john_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_1_0_1

 

\"Don\'t.\"

>Continue mc_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_1_0_1_1

 

\"You loved her.\"

 

\"You loved her and held on to her so tight that she\'d almost dragged you down with her.\"

>Continue mc_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_1_0_1_1_1

 

\"You were drowning. Perhaps, you still are. Do not do to him what you\'ve done to her.\"

 

\"Be better.\"

[Return] mc_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_0_1_1_1 He draws his shoulders back, as if readying himself for the incoming conversation.\n\n John doesn\'t like talking about \"last night.\" He doesn\'t like talking about any nights, for the matter. Emotional vulnerability isn\'t something he\'s particularly good at. >Continue John john_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_2_0_1

 

Still, he relents. For you.

 

He\'s trying to be better, too.

>Continue John john_under_pier under_the_pier Scenario_3_3_2_0_1_1

 

"Yes?"
